p: Perhaps surprisingly, the proportion of species for which an effect of a climatic variable was reported did not differ between studies that only investigated climatic factors (proportion = 0.81, 95% CL: 0.73–0.84) and those that included more than one factor in their model (proportion = 0.81, 95% CL: 0.75–0.86). This difference was not statistically significant ( p = 0.55, n = 432 species–study combinations, n = 104 studies). The listed p-values are the probabilities from logistic regressions testing for differences in the rates of detection of climate effects dependent on whether only climate predictors were considered in the study or not.
